bibl.title: Despatch from M. A. Aenmey to J. C. Bancroft Davis
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

correspAction.persName: Davis, J. C. Bancroft (John Chandler Bancroft), 1822-1907

div1.p:
Consulate General of the United States
Monrovia July 1st 1882.
Mr. M. A Aenmey to the Assist Secretary of State

Consulate General of the United States
Monrovia July 1e 1882.
I have the honor to forward the enclosed quarterly accounts and returns, for the quarter ending June 30th 1882.
Please find the enclosed returns and accounts as follows.
Digest of Invoice book #1. Arrival and departure of American vessels #2. Sumary of Consular business #3 Aggregate return of fees #4 Rent and Miscellaneous Expences account with Voucher #5

I am, Sir,
Your obedient Servant
M. A Aenmey.
div1.fw:
Hon. J. C. Bancroft Davis
Assist Secretary of State
Washington D.C.
div1.p:
1 Digest of Invoice book.
2 Arrival and Departure of American vessels
3 Sumary of Consular business
5 Rent and miscellaneous expences with vouchers
4 Aggregate return of all fees received during the fiscal year ending June 30 1882
Summary of business of the United States Consulate General at Monrovia, during the quarter ended June 30 1882.

row.cell: Vessels in port from the last quarter
Seamen in port from last quarter

div1.p:
Consulate General of the United States
at Monrovia, June 30, 1882
M. A Aenmey.
U.S. Consul.
